Key Match Events: Taj Bradley limited Cleveland's potent lineup to just one run on three hits in the first four innings
Angel Martínez scored from third when José Ramírez was caught stealing at second
Yandy Díaz and Brandon Lowe opened the sixth with back-to-back singles
Cade Smith shut down the Rays’ threat by getting Junior Caminero and Dylan Carlson to strike out and Jonathan Aranda to pop out
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Kevin Cash emphasized the importance of intensity and learning experiences for the young roster
Bradley relied heavily on his splitter and fastball, which is around his season usage
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Kevin Cash felt like the intensity has been there, but the team hasn't won every series and tight games
Taj Bradley said the month of August was a learning experience with bumps and bruises, and he took positives from it
Ben Rortvedt said Bradley's fastball command got better as the game went on, and he had some misfires but those could set them up for things later in the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rays' grueling road trip against three straight division leaders is complete
The loss closed out a 4-6 road trip that was highlighted by a series win over the Orioles last week and a series split against the Guardians this weekend
The Rays are in danger of recording their first losing season since ‘17
The team will need to go 9-3 over their last 12 games to secure a winning record
Others: The Rays will rely on young players like Taj Bradley in the future
The rotation is the Rays' strong point entering '25
The Rays finalized an extension with Rasmussen: 'He's a dominant pitcher, period'
